intro: Bouvardia splendens, commonly known as the flame vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces clusters of bright orange or red blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Bouvardia splendens thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often used in hanging baskets or as a trailing plant in gardens due to its ornamental value.
